page.title: 10THE EVENING TELEGRAPH
page.content:
THE EVENING TELEGRAPH
Thie is our local paper.It covers events in the east of the county and this includes the Rushden area.It is delivered or bought from shops for six days of each week,although The Leader and The Post,two other papers,are delivered free.The Post is mainly a paper devoted to adverts and leisure over the weekend.It has some competitions and at least two catoons,"Maxwell" and "B.C".The Leader also ha some adverts but is more devoted to competitions and news items.Their cartoons include "Horace and Doris","Did You Know?" and "What's in a Name?",which finds out what your name means. Simon Smith.
